question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to make the generated code executable for display whenever possible. Please help me implement this SVG image using code. The toilet has a flusher.

checklist.title: Is the toilet shape completely and accurately implemented in SVG?
checklist.description: Check if the code properly implements the basic toilet structure including the bowl, tank, seat, and base using SVG elements (rect, path, ellipse, etc.). Look for proper proportions and realistic toilet shape. Deduct 5 points if major components are missing, 3 points for unrealistic proportions. Give 10 points for a complete and anatomically correct toilet representation.

checklist.title: Is the flusher mechanism properly implemented and functional?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the code includes an interactive flusher that responds to user input (click/touch events). The flusher should have visual feedback (depression/movement) and trigger a flushing animation. Deduct 5 points if the flusher exists but isn't interactive, 3 points if interaction lacks visual feedback. The full score is 10 points for a fully functional and visually responsive flushing mechanism.

checklist.title: Does the code implement a complete flushing animation?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes a water flushing animation effect that realistically simulates water movement (using SVG animations, CSS transitions, or JavaScript). Look for water swirl effects, changing water levels, and proper animation timing (2-4 seconds for a complete flush cycle). Score 5 points for basic water movement, 10 points for realistic fluid dynamics with proper timing and transitions.

checklist.title: Are appropriate SVG gradient/shading techniques used to create a realistic appearance?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the implementation uses SVG gradient fills, filters, or shading techniques to create depth and realism. Look for proper light source consistency, use of <linearGradient> or <radialGradient> for ceramic surfaces, and subtle shadows. Deduct 3 points for flat/unrealistic rendering, 5 points for inconsistent lighting. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as browser compatibility issues, responsive scaling, or event handling errors) and provide fallbacks when necessary. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Sound effects for flushing 2. Water ripple effects 3. Interactive lid/seat that can be raised/lowered). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant SVG elements or overlapping paths 2. Unnecessary animations or effects unrelated to toilet functionality 3. Over-complicated code that could be simplified. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular organization (separating structure/style/animation logic), code reusability, and maintenance considerations. Deduct 5 points if inline styles are overused instead of CSS classes; deduct 5 points if animation code is tightly coupled with structure; deduct 5 points if there's no clear organization of SVG components. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual representation meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Appropriate color choices for ceramic/water elements 2) Proper proportions and scale 3) Clean lines and smooth curves without jagged edges. Deduct 3 points for unrealistic colors, 5 points for poor proportions, and 5 points for low-quality path definitions with visible artifacts. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the interaction smooth and responsive?
checklist.description: Judge whether the interactive elements conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Flusher click feedback delay â‰¤ 100ms 2) Flushing animation timing feels natural (not too fast/slow) 3) Clear visual feedback for all user interactions. Deduct 5 points for delayed response to user input, 3 points for choppy animations, and 5 points for confusing or missing interaction affordances. The full score is 10 points.
